deprecation.message:
DotNetBrowser 1.x is no longer officially supported by TeamDev:
https://dotnetbrowser-support.teamdev.com/docs/guides/migration/v1-v2.html#how-long-will-dotnetbrowser-version-1x-be-supported

description:
A Chromium-based WPF/WinForms component that can be embedded into your .NET application to display modern web pages built with HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, Silverlight etc.

To be able to use DotNetBrowser, you should obtain a licence by filling a form at https://www.teamdev.com/dotnetbrowser#evaluate
releaseNotes:
DotNetBrowser 1.8.2 comes with the following new features and improvements:
Implemented C# objects support for JSFunction.Invoke(). In previous versions, only primitive types and DotNetBrowser JS wrappers could be used as parameters. Now it is possible to pass .NET objects as parameters to JavaScript function call. 
Added ability to specify WebRTC IP handling policy. This allows to prevent exposing of the local IP addresses to servers.
Simplified embedding for lightweight controls. The previous version allowed embedding lightweight controls from source code only.  Now they can be embedded from Toolbox or XAML directly.
Properties and events of the BrowserView controls are now available in the Designer.
DOM API update: now you can attach a single event listener to several DOM events by a single call.
Added JavaScript context events. These events can be used to execute any JavaScript code before the web page JavaScript is executed.
DOM API update: added LINQ support for XPath. Now you can use LINQ expressions to work with nodes returned after evaluating XPath expression.
Improved performance for saving web page as image in the lightweight mode.
Improved lightweight rendering performance.

This version also includes fixes for several issues:

Fixed DotNetBrowser crash when handling custom cursors. This issue was reproducible when the custom cursor is detected in Chromium, but no image provided for it.
Fixed several issues in the default context menu implementation.
Fixed ComboBox auto-close issue, which was reproducible when some popup windows were open.
Fixed issue with debugger hanging on public properties evaluation.
summary: Solution for integration of Chromium-based component into .NET applications.
title: DotNetBrowser
